III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Development of service plans
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418
Section (2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
Description child and parent or parents, as follows:
1

(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the
home.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation To date, there is no ISP given to Mother of Youth A or her
attorney.
Investigation Allegation was made that this agency did not complete/provide an
approved Initial Service Plan as required by this rule.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by telephone on 5/8/2024.
Complainant reported Youth A was in Midland County when the
removal request was made, but it was filed in Oakland County as
the family was already working with another child placing agency
at the time.
I interviewed Complainant by telephone again on 5/17/2024.
Complainant stated Judson does not have the case for Youth A as
another child placing agency has direct responsibility working with
Youth A and the family of Youth A.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by telephone on 5/17/2024.
Chief Administrator stated the agency was never assigned
responsibility for case management services for Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
The initial service plan for Youth A indicated a time period of
2/23/2024 to 3/22/2024. It was approved 3/22/2024.
The initial service plan was completed by Oakland County DHHS
and confirmed the case for Youth A was the responsibility of
Oakland County DHHS as determined by a court hearing/order.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule as they were
never assigned responsibility for Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
